revisions.rev:
{{Redirect|Alesha||Alicia (disambiguation){{!}}Alicia}} {{good article}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Alesha Dixon | image = AleshaDixonL2008.jpg | alt = | caption = Dixon performing in Leeds in 2008. | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Alesha Anjanette Dixon | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1978|10|7}} | birth_place = [[Welwyn Garden City]], [[Hertfordshire]], United Kingdom | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[hip hop music|hip hop]], [[UK garage]] | occupation = [[Singer]], [[songwriter]], [[model (person)|model]], [[rapper]], [[dancer]], [[television presenter]] | years_active = 1999âpresent | label = [[Polydor Records]] (2005â2006)
[[Asylum Records]] (2008â2011)
[[Atlantic Records]] (2008â2011) | associated_acts = [[Mis-Teeq]]
[[Roll Deep]]
[[Jay Sean]] | website = {{URL|aleshadixon.com}} | notable_instruments = }} '''Alesha Anjanette Dixon''' (born 7 October 1978){{cite web|url= http://www.mtv.co.uk/artists/alesha-dixon |title= MTV - Alesha Dixon |publisher= MTV| date=|accessdate=2009-08-04}} is an [[English people|English]] [[singer-songwriter]], [[dancer]], [[Model (person)|model]] and [[television personality]]. She first found fame in the all-female [[R&B]] trio [[Mis-Teeq]], however, the trio separated in 2005 and Dixon continued pursuing her music career as a solo artist, signing to [[Polydor Records]]. Dixon began recording her debut solo album, ''[[Fired Up (Alesha album)|Fired Up]]'' in 2006, but due to poor record sales of her first two singles, "[[Lipstick (Alesha song)|Lipstick]]" and "[[Knockdown (song)|Knockdown]]", she was dropped from Polydor.{{cite web|url= http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/a114433/alesha-discusses-record-label-axe.html |title= Alesha discusses records label axe |publisher=Digital Spy| date=2008-07-24 |accessdate=2009-08-04}} In 2007 Dixon became a contestant on ''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'' and eventually won. Her television exposure led to a successful comeback,{{Cite news|author=Amelia Donovan |title= The Rise and Rise of Alesha|url= http://entertainment.uk.msn.com/tv/realitytv/strictly-come-dancing/gallery.aspx?cp-documentid=148479297>1=61503|work= [[MSN]]|date= 2009-07-13|accessdate= 2009-07-13}} which included her signing to [[Asylum Records]], an offshoot of [[Warner Music Group]]. Dixon then released a second album, entitled ''[[The Alesha Show]]'' in 2008, which received [[platinum certification]] from [[British Phonographic Industry|BPI]] in the UK. In September 2009 Dixon became a judge on the [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 7)|seventh series]] of ''Strictly Come Dancing'', replacing fellow judge [[Arlene Phillips]].{{Cite news |title= Alesha Dixon joins Strictly team |url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/newsid_8140000/newsid_8142400/8142406.stm|work= [[BBC]]|date=|accessdate= 2011-11-07}} The replacement of Phillips by Dixon attracted criticism, as some questioned the extent of Dixon's dancing knowledge.{{Cite news|author=Stephen Brook |title= Alesha Dixon's debut as Strictly judge draws more than 250 complaints |url= http://www.guardian.co.uk/tv-and-radio/2009/sep/21/alesha-dixon-strictly-come-dancing|work= [[The Guardian]]|date=2009-09-21|accessdate= 2009-09-23 | location=London}} Dixon herself dismissed the criticism, describing it as a "storm in a teacup", and refused to stand down as judge.{{cite news|url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1214802/Strictly-Come-Dancing-Backlash-begins-Alesha-Dixon-complaints-flood-BBC.html |title= Strictly Come Dancing: Alesha Dixon says backlash is just a 'storm in a teacup' |publisher= [[The Daily Mail]] | date=2009-09-22 |accessdate=2009-09-23 | location=London}} In 2010 Dixon returned for the [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 8)|eighth series]] of ''Strictly Come Dancing'' and released her third studio album, ''[[The Entertainer (Alesha Dixon album)|The Entertainer]]''. Dixon has also hosted [[Children in Need]] in 2008, 2009 and 2011 alongside [[Terry Wogan]], [[Tess Daly]] and [[Fearne Cotton]]. ==Early life== Alesha Anjanette Dixon was born in [[Welwyn Garden City]], [[Hertfordshire]], on 7 October 1978, to an English mother, Beverly Harris, and [[Jamaica]]n father, Melvin Dixon; she is [[Mixed (United Kingdom ethnicity category)|mixed race]]. Dixon has five half-brothers named Adrian, Mark, John, Jeroame, Callum and one half-sister called Leyanne. She was educated at [[Monk's Walk School]], Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire. Dixon's mother and father split up when Dixon was four years old and Dixon's father moved away, resulting in Dixon later describing her family life as "very dysfunctional".{{cite news|author= Andrew Billen |url= http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article6917710.ece|title= Alesha Dixon: I'm no pushover, you'll see |publisher=''[[The Times]]''|date= 2009-11-16|accessdate=2009-12-11 | location=London}} Between the ages of eight and ten, Dixon witnessed her mother suffer [[domestic abuse]] from her partner;{{cite news|author= Kelly Mattison |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/society/2010/nov/16/alesha-dixon-documentary-domestic-violence |title= Alesha Dixon presents BBC show on domestic violence|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date= 2010-11-16|accessdate=2011-01-19 | location=London}} she only spoke publicly about the issue 21 years later, in 2010. Dixon created a documentary for the [[BBC]], ''Don't Hit My Mum'', regarding the issue of domestic abuse from a child's perspective, and remarked upon her own childhood: "When I think about that time, I don't remember living in harmony, I don't remember any fun times, I suppose because the negativity has clouded it. The negative times and the scary times have blocked anything that was good [...] I believe that every child has the right to grow up in an environment where they feel secure and fearless going into the world, and I didn't really feel that". Her first job was at [[Ladbrokes]],{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/money/2009/may/30/alesha-dixon-career |title=Love your work: Alesha Dixon | Money | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date= 2009-05-30|accessdate=2009-07-12 | location=London | first=Deany | last=Judd}} although she aspired to become a [[Physical education|PE]] teacher after leaving college. After completing a diploma course in sports studies, she had planned to take up a place at [[Loughborough University]],{{cite web | url= http://www.gm.tv/articles/showbiz/june-sept-entertainment-archive/22042-alesha.html| title=Alesha Dixon webchat | publisher=[[GMTV]] | accessdate=2009-08-17 }} but whilst at dance classes in London she was approached by a [[Artist and repertoire|talent scout]] from a production company.{{cite news|author= Peter Bradshaw |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2007/dec/08/popandrock.bbc?gusrc=rss&feed=media |title= A star is born. Again |publisher= The Guardian |date= 8 December 2007|accessdate=30 August 2009 | location=London}} Whilst travelling back home on the train she was approached by another scout who was forming a band and asked if she was interested. Dixon's musical hopes had previously been met with scepticism from Melvin Dixon, as he encouraged Alesha to follow a more academic career path.{{cite web|author= Sara Nathan |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/article619506.ece |title= Alesha's family rift heartbreak |publisher= ''[[The Sun (newspaper)|The Sun]]'' |date= 2007-12-26 |accessdate=2010-02-26}} Dixon explained that "his view was there weren't many [[black British]] musicians who were overly successful. I said, 'Dad, I can't base my decision on what people haven't done'". Ignoring her father's advice, Dixon decided to pursue a career in music. ==History== ===1999-05: Mis-Teeq=== Dixon's career began in 1999 when she met [[Sabrina Washington]] when they both joined a dance school in [[Fulham]], south west [[London]].{{cite web|author=Tom Horan |url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/music/article-896089-mis-teeq-its-a-uk-thing.do |title=Mis-teeq: It's a UK thing |publisher=''[[London Evening Standard]]'' |date=2001-11-02 |accessdate=2010-02-27}} Together they decided to form a band when Dixon and Washington, the two co-founders, spotted [[Su-Elise Nash]], a girl auditioning for another band. Dixon and Washington proposed that Nash join the group and together they formed a trio. They were soon signed to [[Telstar Records]] with the addition of a new member, [[Zena McNally]], and became the popular [[UK garage]]/[[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] girl band, [[Mis-Teeq]]. After months of recording throughout 1999 and early 2000, [[Mis-Teeq]] released their debut single "[[Why? (Mis-Teeq song)|Why?]]" in January 2001, however, it was not long before McNally left the band.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/music/artist/mis_teeq/artist.jhtml#bio|title=MTV â Mis-Teeq Bio |publisher=MTV | date= |accessdate=2009-08-02}} The band made a decision to remain a trio. In October 2001, they released their debut album ''[[Lickin' On Both Sides]]'', featuring hits "[[All I Want (Mis-Teeq song)|All I Want]]", "[[One Night Stand (song)|One Night Stand]]", "[[B with Me]]" and double A-side single "[[Roll On/This Is How We Do It]]". In 2002 Mis-Teeq performed and received a nomination at the [[BRIT Awards]] in [[Earls Court Exhibition Centre|Earls Court]],{{cite web|url= http://www.brits.co.uk/history/shows/2002 |title= 2002 BRIT Awards|publisher=brits.co.uk | date=|accessdate=2011-11-07}} later in the year band won the [[MOBO Awards|MOBO Award]] for Best Garage Act.{{cite web|url= http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/t4/microsites/M/mobo/best_ofthe_rest_04.html |title= MOBO Awards - Mis-Teeq|publisher=Channel 4 | date= |accessdate=2009-08-02}} After the success of their debut album, 2003 saw Mis-Teeq becoming the faces of [[JD Sports]] stores nationwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/3am/2003/11/13/meet-mis-teeq-115875-13609629/ |title=Meet Mis-Teeq! |publisher=mirror.co.uk |date=2003-11-13 |accessdate=2009-07-12}}{{cite web|url=http://rnbdirt.com/mis-teeq-launce-reebok-clothing-line/5121/ |title=Mis-Teeq Launch Reebok Clothing Line |publisher=rnbdirt.com |date=2003-11-17 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} In 2003, Mis-teeq released their second album ''[[Eye Candy (album)|Eye Candy]]'', which included the singles "[[Scandalous (Mis-Teeq song)|Scandalous]]", "[[Can't Get It Back]]" and "[[Style (song)|Style]]". In 2004, Mis-Teeq toured the United States and released their debut single Scandalous from their American self-titled debut, a compilation of the albums ''Lickin' On Both Sides'' and ''Eye Candy''. They also released "One Night Stand" before coming back to Europe to start work with their third album however, Telstar Records went into administration.{{Cite news|author= Gavin Martin |title= Alesha Dixon reveals all about her rollercoaster career|url= http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/news/2009/05/08/alehsa-dixon-reveals-all-about-her-rollercoaster-career-115875-21342665/|work= [[Daily Mirror]]|date= May 8, 2009|accessdate= 2009-05-28}} The band was left with no choice but to release a Greatest Hits compilation under exclusive licences with [[Universal Records]]. The last song Dixon recorded with Mis-Teeq was "[[Shoo Shoo Baby (song)|Shoo Shoo Baby]]" for the [[The Walt Disney Company|Disney]] film ''[[Valiant (film)|Valiant]]''. In March 2005, their ''Greatest Hits'' compilation was released and it was announced that they were separating to pursue solo careers.{{cite news|url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/4225955.stm |title=Girl group Mis-Teeq to split up |publisher=BBC | date=2005-02-01 |accessdate=2009-08-09}} ===2006-08: ''Fired Up'' and record label departure=== {{Quote box|width=220px|align=right|quote=I never lost the desire to [want to] carry on in music â that's all I know, all I've ever dreamed of doing, itâs all I've ever wanted to do so, I think, never give up. | source=Alesha Dixon, discussing her thoughts on being dropped by her record label, Polydor.{{cite news|url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7709237.stm |title= Talking Shop: Alesha Dixon |publisher=BBC | date=2008-11-07 |accessdate=2009-08-05}}}} Dixon launched her solo career after Mis-Teeq's breakup and signed a Â£500,000, three-album deal with [[Polydor Records]]. She spent a year writing and recording her solo debut album, ''[[Fired Up (Alesha album)|Fired Up]]'', working with a wide range of producers including [[Richard X]], [[Xenomania]], [[Johnny Douglas]], [[Brian Higgins]], [[Estelle (singer)|Estelle]] and Paul Epworth. During this period Dixon performed [[mononymous person|mononymously]], known simply as "Alesha". In June 2005, she announced her first solo single to be "Superficial". However, at the last minute, the song "[[Lipstick (Alesha song)|Lipstick]]" was chosen as the first single.{{cite news| author= Caroline Briggs |title=Alesha returns with added gloss| url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/5236418.stm|publisher= BBC | date=2006-08-07 |accessdate=2009-08-05}} "Lipstick" was released on 14 August 2006, and charted at 14 on the [[UK Single Charts]]. She released her second single "[[Knockdown (song)|Knockdown]]" on 30 October 2006, which charted at 25 on the [[UK Download Chart]]. However on the official [[UK Singles Charts]], the single peaked at number 45, falling down to 68 the following week. On 6 November 2006, it was revealed that Dixon had been dropped by her [[record label|label]], Polydor Records. Polydor gave her full rights to her unreleased debut album, ''Fired Up''. Her first single from the album, "Lipstick", got to number 1 in Japan's international ringtone chart and number 2 in MTV Japan's hit list. ''[[Fired Up (Alesha album)|Fired Up]]'' was officially released in Japan on 20 February 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B00120VGTQ |title=Fired Up: Alesha: Music |publisher=Amazon.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} ===2008-09: ''The Alesha Show''=== [[Image:Alesha Dixon 3.jpg|thumb|upright|Dixon performing at the Christmas lights switch on in Leeds 6 November 2008.]] After her victory on ''Strictly Come Dancing'' Dixon soon became at the centre of a bidding war between record labels, and even [[Polydor Records]], the label that had dropped her months previously, put in an offer.{{cite news|author= Peter Robinson |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2008/oct/12/aleshadixon.music |title='Dancing costs nothing' |publisher=''[[The Observer]]'' |date=2008-10-12 |accessdate=2010-04-09 | location=London}} Dixon, however, chose to sign a four-album contract with [[Asylum Records]] in 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/a114433/alesha-discusses-record-label-axe.html |title=Music - News - Alesha discusses record label axe |publisher=Digital Spy |date=2008-07-24 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Dixon's first new album as part of her contract, ''[[The Alesha Show (album)|The Alesha Show]]'' was released in the UK on 24 November 2008 and 21 November in Ireland. The official first single from the album, "[[The Boy Does Nothing]]" became her first solo top ten hit{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/song/40184 |title=Alesha Dixon - The Boy Does Nothing - Music Charts |publisher=Acharts.us |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} on the [[UK Singles Chart]], following a 76 spot jump from 84 to 8 on the UK Singles Chart chart on downloads alone. The single eventually peaked at number 5. The song also fared well in continental Europe and is rising on the Australian Singles Chart. The second single from ''The Alesha Show'' was "[[Breathe Slow]]" and entered the UK Singles Chart at number thirty-nine solely on download sales.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/song/41266 |title=Alesha Dixon - Breathe Slow - Music Charts |publisher=Acharts.us |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} The single rose for three weeks before breaking into the top ten at number six, giving Dixon her second top ten hit in the UK from downloads alone, and eventually peaked at number 3 on the Top 40 UK Charts, giving Dixon her second consecutive top 5 single. She also put a song up on her website for free download on 19 October 2008 named "Colours of the Rainbow". The third single from ''The Alesha Show'', titled "[[Let's Get Excited]]" was physically released on 11 May and reached a peak position of 13 in the UK Singles Chart. "Let's Get Excited" became Dixon's first track from ''The Alesha Show'' not to chart inside the top 10 in the UK Singles Chart. The song's presence in the charts boosted album sales and ''The Alesha Show'' rebounded at a new peak of 11. On 9 June it was announced on Dixon's official website that the album had received [[platinum certification]] from [[British Phonographic Industry|BPI]], indicating sales of 300,000+ in the [[United Kingdom|UK]] alone.{{cite web|url=http://www.aleshadixon.co.uk/news,aleshas-album-has-now-gone-platinum_116.htm |title=Alesha's album has now gone Platinum |publisher=Alesha Dixon official site| date=2009-06-09 |accessdate=2009-08-02}} The fourth single from ''The Alesha Show'', called "[[To Love Again (song)|To Love Again]]" was released on 15 November 2009.{{cite web|author=David Balls |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/a177896/alesha-dixon-to-release-barlow-penned-track.html |title=Alesha Dixon to release Barlow-penned track |publisher=Digital Spy |date= 2009-09-17 |accessdate=2009-09-17}} The track, a ballad penned by Dixon and [[Gary Barlow]], was the first single taken from the deluxe version, entitled ''The Alesha Show - Encore'', released on 23 November.{{cite web|url=http://www.popjustice.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=4050&Itemid=206 |title=Alesha Dixon's new single: It has every chance of being above average |publisher=Popjustice| date=2009-09-17 |accessdate=2009-09-17}} Dixon also embarked upon a 17-date national tour, named [[The Alesha Show (tour)|The Alesha Show]], which began on 20 October 2009 in [[Nottingham]]. ===2010-present: ''The Entertainer'' and Mis-Teeq reunion=== In early 2010, Dixon began work on her third studio album, ''[[The Entertainer (Alesha Dixon album)|The Entertainer]]'', which she intended to release during the summer. In May 2010 the ''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'' claimed that Dixon has been working with producer [[Jim Beanz]] and that Beanz stated "We're going to build some up-tempo dance songs to take the UK and the US by storm".{{cite web|author=Kim Dawson |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/posts/view/133927/Exclusive-Alesha-Dixon-to-go-global-with-Britney-Spears-pr |title= Exclusive: Alesha to go global with Britney Spears' producer|publisher=''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'' |date=2010-05-06 |accessdate=2010-05-14}} She hopes to release the album in the US. Dixon's fansite also stated that Dixon had confirmed that she would once again be creating music with [[Xenomania]], the producers who created "[[The Boy Does Nothing]]".{{cite web|author=Rachel Dayman |url=http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?p=2031 |title= Exclusive: Third Album Details |publisher=AleshaDixon.net |date=2010-02-25 |accessdate=2010-05-14}} On 15 March Dixon flew to [[Denmark]] to begin recording with [[Soulshock & Karlin]], the producers of Dixon's "[[Breathe Slow]]".{{cite web|author=Rachel Dayman |url=http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?p=2093 |title= Alesha's recording in Denmark |publisher=AleshaDixon.net |date=2010-03-12 |accessdate=2010-05-14}} Dixon's fan site later reported that Dixon had secured a recording session with [[Rodney Jerkins]], a record producer who has produced records for [[Michael Jackson]]'s final studio album ''[[Invincible (Michael Jackson album)|Invincible]]'' and most recently produced [[Lady Gaga]] and [[BeyoncÃ© Knowles|BeyoncÃ©]]'s "[[Telephone (song)|Telephone]]".{{cite web|author=Rachel Dayman |url=http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?p=2093 |title= Alesha to work with Rodney Jerkins |publisher=AleshaDixon.net |date=2010-04-20 |accessdate=2010-05-14}} Dixon herself later confirmed via a diary update not on her official site but her fansite that she had recorded 2 tracks with Soulshock & Karlin and also revealed she had just finished recording a new track named "Bionic".{{cite web|author=Alesha Dixon|url= http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?p=2114|title= Message from Alesha |publisher=AleshaDixon.net |date=2010-03-29 |accessdate=2010-05-14}} Dixon described "Bionic" as "a powerful, fun, quirky song all about being strong when life tests you". On 16 June Dixon revealed on a post on her fansite that the upcoming album is to be called ''Unleashed'',{{cite web|author=Alesha Dixon|url=http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?p=2216 |title= Update from Alesha |publisher=AleshaDixon.net |date=2010-06-16 |accessdate=2010-06-30}} and on 30 June her fansite president revealed the [[lead single]] is a track called "[[Drummer Boy (song)|Drummer Boy]]", produced by Haitian-American producer, Shama Joseph p/k/a "Sham" or "ShamRock".{{cite web|author=Rachel Dayman|url=http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?p=2222|title= The new single 'Drummer Boy' |publisher=AleshaDixon.net |date=2010-06-30 |accessdate=2010-06-30}} Dixon has also announced that she has worked with [[Busbee (songwriter)|Busbee]], who wrote [[Alexandra Burke]]'s "[[Bad Boys (Alexandra Burke song)|Bad Boys]]", on new tracks for her album, and has also announced that she and [[Gary Barlow]] have "become good friends" and he is to write for her new album.{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1292683/Alesha-Dixon-takes-underwear-outerwear-trend-extreme-sexy-basque--else.html?ito=feeds-newsxml | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=Alesha Dixon takes to the stage in sexy black basque... and not much else | first=Sarah | last=Bull | date=2010-07-07}} On 5 August it was revealed that Dixon had decided to change the album name from ''Unleashed'' to ''[[The Entertainer (Alesha Dixon album)|The Entertainer]]''.{{cite web|author=Rachel Dayman|url=http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?p=2423|title= Alesha changes album title |publisher=AleshaDixon.net |date=2010-08-05 |accessdate=2010-08-05}} On 16 September it was announced that Dixon has collaborated with [[Roll Deep]], and features the band's forthcoming single "[[Take Control (Roll Deep song)|Take Control]]".{{cite web|author=Tigo Sigel |url=http://www.rwdmag.com/2010/09/roll-deep-hook-up-with-alesha-dixon-for-new-single/|title= NEWS : Roll Deep Hook-Up With Alesha Dixon For New Single|publisher=''[[Rewind Magazine|RWD]]'' |date=2010-09-16 |accessdate=2010-09-16}} The second single from the album is "[[Radio (Alesha Dixon song)|Radio]]". The third single was confirmed to be "Every Little Part of Me", which features guest vocals from [[Jay Sean]]. Other album cuts include "La La La" and "Cool with Me," which were written in part or full by another "[[Bad Boys (Alexandra Burke song)|Bad Boys]]" writer, [[Alex James (songwriter)|Alex James]]. Upon the release of The Entertainer, the album charted poorly only peaking at number eighty-four on the [[UK Albums Chart]]. The second single released with the album also charted lowly, only peaking at number forty-six on the [[UK Singles Chart]]. Subsequently, Alesha and her record label Atlantic/Asylum parted ways. In early 2011, rumours began to surface that Dixon's band, [[Mis Teeq]] would be reforming. ==Other projects== [[Image:Alesha Dixon crop.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Dixon performing in 2009.]] In January 2008, less than a month after her profile was raised due to her victory on ''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'', Dixon signed a deal with [[Ford]] to endorse the new [[Ford Focus (International)|Ford Focus]], an ad campaign featuring her was made, and a track called '4 U I Will' was recorded using real car parts. Dixon said, "When Ford first showed me the original TV ad and the incredible instruments I immediately wanted to get involved." Some of the instruments being used were the 'door harp', the 'clutch guitar' and the 'hatchback kick drum', in total 21 parts were taken from the car and transformed into unique looking instruments.[http://www.cakegroup.com/archive/lib/pdf/171_strictly-star-fronts-ford-focus-or-car-stra.pdf Press Release: Ford - Strictly Star Fronts Ford Focus Or-Car-Stra]([[Portable Document Format|PDF]]) Cakegroup.com. Retrieved 2011-11-07. In February 2008 Dixon fronted a campaign for the [[Department of Health]], promoting [[safe sex]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/celebrity-news/249210/see-pic-alesha-dixon-poses-naked/1/ |title=SEE PIC Alesha Dixon poses naked | Celebrity News |publisher=Now Magazine |date=2008-02-14 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} The sum of money she received was never disclosed despite calls to have the sum made public.{{cite web|url=http://www.libdemvoice.org/alesha-dixon-9578.html |title=How much have you paid Alesha Dixon? Â» Liberal Democrat Voice |publisher=Libdemvoice.org |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}}{{Cite news|author= Denis Campbell|title= Cash for stars in NHS ad kept secret|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2009/jan/04/nhs-advertising-fees-freedom-information|work= [[The Guardian]]|date= 2009-01-04|accessdate= 2009-08-07 | location=London}} Later in 2008 Alesha became the face of a new [[Veet]] campaign.{{cite web|url=http://www.look.co.uk/news/details.cfm?articleID=2058170f693143859a44b85959a9eff4&pageref=beauty |title=Alesha Dixon Launches The New Veet Collection - News |publisher=Look |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} In May 2009, Dixon collaborated with clothing label ''Dune'', selling limited edition necklaces, with all the profits being donated to the [[Teenage Cancer Trust]]. John Eagen, Duneâs CEO stated that "they are delighted to have Alesha support this cause". The necklace, which consists of three layers of gold, pewter and silver balls, was launched by Dixon to help raise awareness for the charity.{{cite news|last=Thrower |first=Kimberly |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/fashion/5357337/Alesha-Dixon-launches-limited-edition-necklace-for-Teenage-Cancer-Trust.html |title=Alesha Dixon launches limited edition necklace for Teenage Cancer Trust |publisher=Telegraph |date=2009-05-20 |accessdate=2009-07-12 | location=London}} In June 2009, Dixon fronted a new campaign for [[Toblerone]] chocolate, offering fans a free download of an exclusive new track called "Before the Sun Goes Down".{{cite web|url=http://www.7digital.com/stores/default.aspx?shop=1181 |title=Toblerone |publisher=7digital.com |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Fans were also able to enter a competition to win a pair of VIP tickets to see Dixon in concert and meet her. Jane Furze, Toblerone Marketing Manager said in a statement, "We're delighted to have Alesha on board - she's a great personality and the perfect fit with the brand".{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/e3idff59d66183db868fc7d215de3221276 |title=Alesha Dixon Fronts Toblerone Campaign |publisher=Billboard.biz |date=2009-06-12 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} In November 2009, it was announced that Dixon had signed a signed a four-year profit sharing deal with LA Fitness, to become brand ambassador for the gym chain as part of their multi-million pound re-launch scheme.{{cite web|last=Tyldesley |first=Hazel |url= http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/Business/Alesha-Dixon-Swaps-Ballroom-For-Boardroom-As-She-Signs-LA-Fitness-Deal/Article/200912115481984?lpos=Business_First_Buisness_Article_Teaser_Region_4&lid=ARTICLE_15481984_Alesha_Dixon_Swaps_Ballroom_For_Boardroom_As_She_Signs_LA_Fitness_Deal |title=Alesha Dixon Swaps Ballroom For Boardroom|publisher=[[Sky News]]|date=2009-12-02 |accessdate=2009-12-07}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cityam.com/news-and-analysis/alesha-dixon-dances-her-way-lafitness-role |title=Alesha Dixon dances her way to LA Fitness role|publisher= City A.M.|date=2009-12-01 |accessdate=2011-11-07}} Dixon's contract was described as "unique" by LA Fitness,{{cite web|url=http://www.lafitness.co.uk/alesha.htm |title=Alesha Dixonm turns business woman as she dances into exclusive partnership with LA Fitness |publisher=LA Fitness|date=|accessdate=2009-12-07}} as Dixon is not only endorsing the gym chain, but taking on an advisory role. The pay Dixon receives is in direct correlation to the gym's success over the term of the deal,{{cite web|last=Farey-Jones|first=Daniel|url=http://www.brandrepublic.com/News/970351/Alesha-Dixon-joins-LA-Fitness-results-based-deal/ |title=Alesha Dixon joins LA Fitness in results-based deal|publisher=Brand Republic|date=2009-11-30 |accessdate=2009-12-07}} meaning Dixon could earn up to Â£3 million in bonuses,{{cite web|last=Tobin |first=Lucy|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard-business/article-23777067-alesha-eyes-healthy-earner.do |title=Alesha eyes healthy earner at LA Fitness|publisher=London Evening Standard |date=2009-11-30 |accessdate=2009-12-07}} considerably higher than the flat-fee that endorsers usually receive. When asked by ''[[The Observer]]'' in 2010 whether celebrities have a responsibility to do good works, Dixon replied: "Absolutely. There are so many things you could reel off as negatives â your private life is exposed, every move is scrutinised â at the same time, you can think: 'Wow, I'm in a position to shine a light into these areas.' That's a powerful tool because, actually, it's quite a selfish job. It's a moral responsibility, I guess, I think I have."{{cite news|author=Elizabeth Day |url= http://www.guardian.co.uk/culture/2010/oct/10/alesha-dixon-strictly-come-dancing|title=Alesha Dixon: 'There's nothing I can't do'|publisher=''[[The Observer]]''|date=2010-10-10 |accessdate=2011-01-19 | location=London}} In 2009 Alesha climbed [[Mt Kilimanjaro]] in Tanzania for [[Comic Relief]]. Joining her on the climb were [[Girls Aloud]] members [[Cheryl Cole]] and [[Kimberley Walsh]], [[Ben Shephard]], [[Gary Barlow]], [[Ronan Keating]], [[Fearne Cotton]], [[Denise Van Outen]], and [[Chris Moyles]].{{cite news|author=Lizzie Smith |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1160068/On-world-Joy-Cheryl-Alesha-reach-summit-Mount-Kilimanjaro.html |title=On top of the world: Joy as Cheryl, Alesha and co reach the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2009-07-03 |accessdate=2009-07-12 | location=London}} Together they raised over Â£3,500,000 towards helping combat [[malaria]] in [[Tanzania]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8387848.stm |title=Fearne Cotton and Kimberley Walsh return to Africa |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-12-01 |accessdate=2009-12-01}} The whole team met [[Gordon Brown]] at [[10 Downing Street]].{{cite web|author=Post to: |url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/latest/2009/03/15/tea-with-pm-for-kilimanjaro-nine-115875-21200451/ |title=Tea with PM for Kilimanjaro nine |publisher=mirror.co.uk |date=2009-03-15 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Dixon had previously been to Downing Street just months before the climb to meet with [[Sarah Brown (spouse)|Sarah Brown]] in honour of the [[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]] ultimate women of the year awards.{{Cite news|author=Lizzie Smith |title=Don't worry Gordon... I'm here to see Sarah! Sex And The City's Kim Cattrall visits Downing Street|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1083575/Dont-worry-Gordon-Im-Sarah-Sex-And-The-Citys-Kim-Cattrall-visits-Downing-Street.html|work= Daily Mail|date= November 6, 2008|accessdate= | location=London}} While discussing the malaria issue in Tanzania, Dixon said,
"I think people in [[England]] take things for granted, we complain about our [[National Health Service (England)|NHS]] system and yes itâs not perfect but believe me itâs far better than what they've got there."{{cite web|date=April 27, 2009 |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=So_2AitDBr8 |title=Comic Relief - Mount Kilimanjaro Climb 2009 - Part 4 |publisher=YouTube |date=2009-04-27 |accessdate=2009-07-12}}
Dixon backed [[Nickelodeon UK|Nickelodeon's]] 'See Something, Say Something' campaign which is the UKâs anti-bullying initiative.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/artists/alesha-dixon/news/39396-alesha-fronts-nickelodeon-bullying-campaign |title=Alesha Fronts Nickelodeon Bullying campaign... | Alesha Dixon | News | MTV UK |publisher=Mtv.co.uk |date=2006-10-01 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} The campaign aims to encourage children to speak out against bullies and help children gain the confidence to tell someone if they, or someone they know is being bullied. As the face of the campaign Alesha said: "Nickelodeon's See Something, Say Something campaign is extremely close to my heart, so I felt compelled to show my support. I was bullied as a child and know how important it is to tell someone about it".{{cite web|url=http://aleshadixon.net/blog/?page_id=61 |title=Aleshadixon.Net |publisher=Aleshadixon.Net |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Dixon is also a patron of the [[African-Caribbean Leukaemia Trust]] (ACLT),{{cite web|url=http://www.aleshadixon.co.uk/good-causes |title=Buy new album, merchandise & tickets at the official Alesha Dixon UK website | good causes |publisher=Aleshadixon.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}}{{cite web|url=http://www.blackmentalhealth.org.uk/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=434&Itemid=117 |title=Black Mental Health UK - African Caribbean Leukaemia Trust, Gift of Life Week from 15th - 21st September |publisher=Blackmentalhealth.org.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} which is a voluntary charity, whose main aim is to increase the number of Black and Mixed Parentage people on the UK Bone Marrow Register. The members of the ACLT freely volunteer their time in attempting to raise awareness in the Black community; enabling potential donors to come forward and be involved in the process of offering hope and a healthy future to someone whose disorder may otherwise prove fatal. In June 2009 Dixon was asked to become an official ambassador for the charity, 'Help a London Child'. In a statement Dixon said "I am very honoured that Help a London Child have asked me to be an ambassador and I have accepted. I have supported the charity for some time now and it makes sense to make my involvement more official. I am looking forward to continuing my support and I have already volunteered to run the Royal Parks Foundation Half Marathon to help raise funds for the charity!" Help a London Child Manager Kate Crabtree said, "This is fantastic news for Help a London Child and we are absolutely delighted. Aleshaâs thoughtfulness and compassion make her the perfect ambassador and we look forward to her continued invaluable support."{{cite web|url=http://www.aleshadixon.co.uk/blog,alesha-dixon-ambassador-for-help-a-london-child-charity_119.htm |title=Buy new album, merchandise & tickets at the official Alesha Dixon UK website | blog |publisher=Aleshadixon.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Speaking in August 2010 to noted UK urban writer Pete Lewis - Assistant Editor of ''[[Blues & Soul]]'' - about her all-round positive attitude towards her philanthropic work, Dixon said: "Being in the entertainment industry I do feel I have a responsibility that comes with my fame. And, while some celebrities may spend their time moaning about the negative things that come along with being famous, my thing is, if you ''are'' in the limelight then why not try to find ''positive'' things that come with it? And for me the most positive thing is shedding light on subjects that matter but don't normally get a look-in!"[http://www.bluesandsoul.com/feature/581/alesha_dixon_diverse_diva/ Alesha interview by Pete Lewis, 'Blues & Soul' September 2010] In May 2011, it has been rumoured that Dixon may possibly replace [[Cheryl Cole]] on the upcoming season of the British [[The X Factor (UK)|X Factor]]. However she turned down the role due to her commitment to [[Strictly Come Dancing]]. In July 2011, Alesha Dixon was announced as associate producer for short film 'Victims' about domestic violence and its consequences, which has been nominated for the Film London Best of Borough Film Awards and is now online.[http://filmlondon.org.uk/best_of_boroughs/victims/ Alesha Dixon, associate producer of film 'Victims', now online] Alesha is a supporter of the [http://www.league.org.uk/content.ASpx?CategoryID=497 League Against Cruel Sports], a charity which works to end cruelty to animals in the name of sport. ==Modelling and television career== As a model, Dixon is represented by [[Select Model Management]] and has appeared on the cover of ''Cosmopolitan'', ''FHM'', ''Arena'', ''Company'', ''Bliss'' and other magazines and in various other [[editorial]] fashion shoots. In 2008 a poll showed that Dixon had "Britain's sexiest legs" beating [[Alexandra Burke]], [[Naomi Campbell]], [[Tiana Benjamin]], [[Lily Cole]] and others.{{cite web|author=Post to: |url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/news/2008/12/18/alesha-dixon-s-legs-voted-best-in-britain-115875-20979112/ |title=Alesha Dixon's legs voted best in Britain |publisher=mirror.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Dixon was cast as the lead female in the music video for "[[She Wants to Move]]" by [[N.E.R.D]]. Dixon has been featured in ''FHM'''s annual ''100 sexiest women in the world'' poll on a number of occasions. She is managed by Malcolm Blair. Dixon has also presented many well-known shows in the UK, such as the ''[[MOBO Awards]]'', ''[[CD:UK]]'', [[ITV2]]'s coverage of ''[[The Brit Awards]]'' and presented the ''[[Live From the Red Carpet]]'' show at the [[62nd British Academy Film Awards]] for [[E!]].{{cite web|url=http://www.celebsource.org/alesha-dixon/alesha-dixon-2009-british-academy-film-awards/ |title=Alesha Dixon @ 2009 British Academy Film Awards | Celebrity News & Pictures |publisher=Celebsource.org |date=2009-02-09 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} She has also been a guest on [[BBC One]]'s current affairs programme ''[[This Week (BBC One TV series)|This Week]]'' on two occasions, in November 2006 and December 2007. In 2009 it was reported that Dixon was in talks with television companies about a possible [[chatshow]].{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/a157395/alesha-dixon-to-host-new-chatshow.html |title=Television - News - Alesha Dixon to host new chatshow |publisher=Digital Spy |date=2009-05-28 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} In 2009 she co-presented [[Children in Need]] alongside [[Terry Wogan]] and [[Tess Daly]], she also presented 2008's coverage from BT Tower. She returned to present the telethon in 2011 alongside [[Fearne Cotton]], [[Tess Daly]] and [[Terry Wogan]]. In March 2010, she presented the [[Mister World 2010]] pageant, which took place in [[Incheon]], [[Korea]]. Dixon took part in series 5 of hit TV show ''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'' in 2007, partnered with professional dancer [[Matthew Cutler]]. Dixon was at first hesitant to join, fearing that snobbery within the [[music industry]] would damage her career. In a later interview she said, "Thereâs always this preconceived idea that people do [[reality TV]] shows because they want to kick-start their careers whereas I was actually worried that it would affect it."{{cite web|url= http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c3g7wX1cQPk |title= [[The Justin Lee Collins Show]] |publisher=[[ITV2]] | date=9 May 2009 |accessdate=30 August 2009}} They had been the favourite from the third week, receiving the most points from the judges on numerous occasions. Dixon herself gained high appraisal from the judges, even being likened to a "young [[Josephine Baker]]" by [[Bruno Tonioli]]. They received 4.5 million votes in the final, beating actor [[Matt Di Angelo]] and professional dancer [[Flavia Cacace]] to win the glitter disco ball.{{cite web|url= http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2007/12_december/22/strictly.shtml |title=Alesha Dixon wins Strictly Come Dancing 2007 |publisher=BBC News |date= 22 December 2007|accessdate=30 August 2009}} Dixon was dubbed the "British [[BeyoncÃ©]]" by ''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'' host [[Bruce Forsyth]],{{cite web|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/39590/alesha-dixon-wins-strictly-come |title=Alesha Dixon Wins Strictly Come Dancing! - Celebrity Gossip, News & Photos, Movie Reviews, Competitions |publisher=Entertainmentwise |date=2007-12-23 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Alesha later said "There's only one BeyoncÃ©. When Bruce said that, I got embarrassed. Itâs very sweet... but itâs not true."{{cite web|author=By SARA NATHANTV Editor |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/article616658.ece |title=Alesha Dixon | I didn't see the point in living .. look at me now | The Sun |Showbiz|TV |publisher=The Sun |date=2007-12-24 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} [[Mis-Teeq]] were often cited as the British equivalent to [[Destiny's Child]]; the trio that first gave BeyoncÃ© media attention.{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/misteeq-shepherds-bush-empire-london-brliza-minnelli-royal-albert-hall-london-brbelle-and-sebastian-brixton-academy-london-656948.html |title=Mis-teeq, Shepherd's Bush Empire, London; Liza Minnelli, Royal Albert Hall, London; Belle and Sebastian, Brixton Academy, London - Reviews, Music |publisher=The Independent |date=2002-04-07 |accessdate=2009-07-12 | first=Simon | last=Price}} Dixon is currently the most successful contestant to ever take part in ''Strictly Come Dancing'', with an average point score of 36.5/40, the highest average score from any contestant to ever take part in the show. {| class="wikitable" |- !'''Week #''' !'''Dance'''/'''Song''' !'''Total''' !'''Result''' |- | style="text-align:center;"|2 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Rumba (dance)|Rumba]]/[[Hurt (Christina Aguilera song)|Hurt]] | style="text-align:center;"|31(8,7,8,8) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|3 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Jive (dance)|Jive]]/[[Shake a Tail Feather]] | style="text-align:center;"|36(9,9,9,9) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|4 | style="text-align:center;"|[[American Smooth]]/[[Top Hat, White Tie and Tails]] | style="text-align:center;"|33(8,8,8,9) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|5 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Foxtrot]]/[[Heaven (DJ Sammy song)|Heaven]] | style="text-align:center;"|36(9,9,9,9) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|6 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Salsa (dance)|Salsa]]/[[Wanna Be Startin' Somethin']] | style="text-align:center;"|35(9,8,9,9) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Waltz]]/[[Romeo and Juliet (1968 film)|A Time For Us]] | style="text-align:center;"|38(9,10,9,10) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|8 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Cha-cha-cha (dance)|Cha Cha Cha]]/[[Crazy in Love (Beyonce song)|Crazy in Love]] | style="text-align:center;"|39(9,10,10,10) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Tango (dance)|Tango]]/[[Jealousy (song)|Jealousy]]{{Disambiguation needed|date=June 2011}}
[[Samba (ballroom)|Samba]]/[[Reach Out I'll Be There]] | style="text-align:center;"|38(9,10,9,10)
36(9,8,10,9) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Viennese Waltz]]/[[Memory (Cats song)|Memory]]
[[Paso Doble]]/[[Toccata]] | style="text-align:center;"|38(9,9,10,10)
36(9,9,9,9) |align="center" {{Partial|Bottom 2}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Quickstep]]/[[Valerie (The Zutons song)|Valerie]]
[[Argentine Tango]]/[[Evita (soundtrack)|I'd Be Surprisingly Good For You]] | style="text-align:center;"|38(9,9,10,10)
38(9,9,10,10) |align="center" {{Yes|Safe}} |- | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|[[Waltz]]/[[Romeo and Juliet (1968 film)|A Time For Us]]
[[Cha-cha-cha (dance)|Cha Cha Cha]]/[[Crazy in Love (Beyonce song)|Crazy in Love]]

35(9,8,9,9) |align="center" {{Yes|'''Winner'''}} |} It was revealed in July 2009 that Alesha would be joining the Strictly Come Dancing judging panel in September 2009.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8142139.stm |title=Entertainment | Dixon joins Strictly dance judges |publisher=BBC News |date= 2009-07-09|accessdate=12 July 2009}} She replaced [[Arlene Phillips]], which led to the [[BBC]] being accused of [[ageism]] and [[sexism]] by the media,{{cite news|url= http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/5787653/BBC-in-ageism-row-after-axing-Strictly-judge-Arlene-Phillips-in-favour-of-Alesha-Dixon.html |title= BBC in ageism row after axing Strictly judge Arlene Phillips in favour of Alesha Dixon |publisher= [[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]| date=9 July 2009 |accessdate=4 August 2009 | location=London | first1=Urmee | last1=Khan}}{{cite web|url= http://tv.sky.com/strictly-backlash |title= Strictly Backlash |publisher= [[British Sky Broadcasting|Sky]] | date=13 July 2009 |accessdate=4 August 2009}} and Dixon herself faced criticism by newspaper columnists such as [[Amanda Platell]] and [[Janet Street-Porter]].{{cite news|author=Amanda Platell |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/debate/article-1194301/Platells-People-Little-Miss-Cleavage-Beebs-bias.html |title=Platell's People: Little Miss Cleavage and the Beeb's against bias | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date= 2009-06-20|accessdate=12 July 2009 | location=London}}{{cite news|author=Janet Street-Porter |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-1194618/Why-I-wont-wear-wacky-T-shirts-raise-cash-charity.html |title=Why I won't wear wacky T-shirts to raise cash for charity | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=23 June 2009 |accessdate=12 July 2009 | location=London}} Dixon, having a conflicting schedule also had to rearrange three dates on her upcoming tour, [[The Alesha Show (tour)|The Alesha Show]] in order to do the show, which is broadcast live on Saturday nights.{{cite web|url= http://www.aleshadixon.co.uk/blog,alesha-confirmed-as-new-strictly-come-dancing-judge_121.htm |title= Alesha confirmed as new Strictly Come Dancing judge |publisher= Alesha Dixon official site | date=9 July 2009 |accessdate=4 August 2009}} The replacement of Arlene Phillips for Alesha Dixon even became dubbed "Alesha-gate" by some (the "[[List of scandals with "-gate" suffix|-gate]]" suffix being a reference to the [[Watergate Scandal]]).{{cite web|author=Jim Shelley |url=http://blogs.mirror.co.uk/shelleyvision/2009/09/strictly-come-dancings-alesha.html |title=Strictly Come Dancing's Alesha Dixon is still better than Cheryl Cole|publisher=''[[Daily Mirror]]'' |date=2009-11-28 |accessdate=2010-06-05 |authorlink=Jim Shelley (TV critic)}} Dixon's judging debut was met by criticism by some viewers, and 272 complaints were received by the BBC, according to ''[[The Guardian]]''.{{cite news|author=Stephen Brook|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/tv-and-radio/2009/sep/21/alesha-dixon-strictly-come-dancing |title=Alesha Dixon's debut as Strictly judge draws more than 250 complaints |publisher=''[[The Guardian]]'' |date=2009-09-21 |accessdate=2010-06-05 | location=London}} In response to the complaints, television critic [[Jim Shelley (TV critic)|Jim Shelley]] commented that "the lynch-mob was such you'd have thought she had strangled a kitten". Despite the complaints, the BBC stated they were "delighted" with Dixon. Arlene Phillips herself stated in response to the claims that "[The BBC] hired Alesha because they wanted a different opinion - a voice of the viewer - and that's what she does. She was never hired to give a technical viewpoint [...] It is very hard for her - she must be incredibly nervous. The judges had all worked together for six series and she is new and on her own."{{cite web|author=Lucy Connolly|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/strictly_come_dancing/2646543/Arlene-Phillips-Strictly-Come-Dancings-lost-some-sparkle.html |title=Strictly's lost some sparkle|publisher=''[[The Sun (newspaper)|The Sun]]'' |date=2009-09-21 |accessdate=2010-06-05}} Fellow judge [[Bruno Tonioli]] accused critics of hypocrisy, saying "this time last year people were calling for Arlene to be sacked on the spot for being rude about [[John Sergeant (journalist)|John Sergeant]] [...] She was the [[Wicked Witch of the West]], now all of a sudden she is [[Mother Teresa]]. What's going on here?"{{cite web|author=|url= http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/strictly_come_dancing/2718664/Bruno-Tonioli-slams-whingeing-fans.html|title=Frank Bruno |publisher=''[[The Sun (newspaper)|The Sun]]'' |date=2009-11-07 |accessdate=2010-06-05}} However, despite Dixon's debut causing hundreds of complaints, critics praised some of her later judging as the series progressed, with Richard Simpson of the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' stating, "it seems Miss Dixon has finally found her voice and is making up for lost time on that point".{{cite news|author=Richard Simpson|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1226148/Straight-talking-Alesha-Dixon-doesnt-pull-punches-Strictly.html |title=Straight-talking Alesha Dixon doesn't pull any punches on Strictly |publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]'' |date=2009-11-09 |accessdate=2010-06-05 | location=London}} ==Personal life== In June 2005, after a five-year relationship, Dixon married artist [[Michael Harvey (artist)|MC Harvey]], formerly of [[So Solid Crew]], in a private ceremony at [[Brocket Hall]], [[Hertfordshire]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-503760/Why-I-walked-Strictlys-Alesha-unfaithful-husband.html |title='Why I walked out on Strictly's Alesha,' by her unfaithful husband | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2007-12-21 |accessdate=2009-07-12 | location=London}} Dixon filed for divorce just over a year later after MC Harvey had an affair with [[Javine Hylton]].{{cite web|url=http://fametastic.co.uk/archive/20071029/8255/alesha-dixon-mc-harvey-regrets-his-affair-but-i-dont/ |title= Alesha Dixon: MC Harvey regrets his affair but I donât |publisher= Fametastic |date=2007-10-29 |accessdate=2009-08-02}} They have no children together.[http://www.contactmusic.com/news.nsf/article/mis-teeq%20star%20distraught%20at%20husbands%20alleged%20infidelity_1012869 ContactMusic.com] She then dated [[West Ham United]] and former [[Valencia CF]] Norwegian international [[John Carew]]; they split in 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/news/2008/05/30/alesha-dixon-splits-from-aston-villa-striker-john-carew-115875-20588291/ |title= Alesha Dixon splits from Aston Villa striker John Carew |publisher= The Daily Mirror |date=2008-05-30 |accessdate=2010-03-24}} After her marriage broke down and her record label dumped her within the space of two weeks, Dixon suffered from depression. In a later interview she said, "It was the lowest point of my life. I just kept thinking, 'What have I done to deserve this?' I didn't see the point in living."{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-504345/Alesha-Ive-gone-suicidal-Strictly-Come-Dancing-queen--Im-set-make-5m.html |title=Alesha: 'I've gone from suicidal to Strictly Come Dancing queen â now I'm set to make Â£5m' | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2007-12-24 |accessdate=2009-07-12 | location=London}} She decided to move on and to turn around her life, saying "When you are knocked down you have two choices - stay down or get back up, stronger."{{cite web|author=Exclusive Interview with: Alesha Dixon |url=http://blogs.mirror.co.uk/the-ticket/2009/05/exclusive-interview-with-alesh.html |title=Exclusive Interview with: Alesha Dixon - The Ticket - TV & Entertainment - Mirror.co.uk |publisher=Blogs.mirror.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2009-07-12}} She said that ''Strictly Come Dancing'' helped her overcome her problems and gave her a "Zest for life"{{cite web|url=http://www.ok.co.uk/celebnews/view/231/Alesha-Strictly-Come-Dancing-saved-me/?printer=1 |title=OK! Magazine: First For Celebrity News :: Celebrity News :: Alesha: Strictly Come Dancing saved me |publisher=Ok.co.uk |date=2007-12-25 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Dixon cut all contact with her older brother, Mark Harris, after he sold his story of their "terrible" childhood, claiming that they "often went to bed hungry" and that her mother, Beverley neglected them in favour of sometimes violent boyfriends, he also accused Dixon of turning her back on her family in the pursuit of fame and fortune.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-504077/Why-Aleshas-troubled-past-desperate-win-Strictly-Come-Dancing.html |title=Why Alesha's troubled past has made her desperate to win Strictly Come Dancing | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date= 2007-12-21|accessdate=2009-07-12 | location=London}} In response to the comments about her mother, Dixon said, "I cherish her. If anyone is rude about her or says a bad word about her they won't be a part of my life. Unfortunately, that's how I feel about my brother."{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-504551/Strictly-Come-Dancing-queen-Alesha-heartbreaking-family-feud.html |title=Strictly Come Dancing queen Alesha on her heartbreaking family feud | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date= 2007-12-26|accessdate=2009-07-12 | location=London}} In February 2009, in an interview with the ''[[Daily Mail]]'', Alesha spoke about her [[Obsessive-compulsive disorder|obsessive-compulsive behaviour]]:
"My friends call me [[Monica Geller|Monica]] because she's the one in ''[[Friends]]'' who's obsessed with cleaning. I always think the house looks messy; a messy house can depress me. It can make me feel messy. If my house is clean and everything is in order, I feel better."{{cite news|author=Rebecca Hardy |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-1137278/Strictly-winner-Alesha-Dixon-obsessive-compulsive-disorder-shes-rebuilt-life-divorce.html|title=Strictly winner Alesha Dixon on her obsessive-compulsive disorder and how she's rebuilt her life after her divorce|publisher=Mail Online |date=February 6, 2009 |accessdate=2009-02-18 | location=London}}
She is currently living with her two dogs, a [[collie]] cross-breed called Roxy and a puppy called Daisy, both were adopted from an [[RSPCA]] animal centre.{{cite web|url= http://www.thisislocallondon.co.uk/news/4523685.Alesha_Dixon_gives_Southridge_puppy_a_new_home/ |title=Alesha gives Southridge puppy a new home|publisher=This is local London | date=2006-08-07 |accessdate=2009-08-02}} Dixon has stated that she hates her own laugh, describing it as sounding like a "[[Crow]]" or "[[Sid James]]"{{cite web|date=March 9, 2009 |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OLdVZVzzTyg |title=Alesha Dixon - funny laughter |publisher=YouTube |date=2009-03-09 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} and saying "I'd change it if I could but it's become a trademark."{{cite web|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/news/2009/05/08/alehsa-dixon-reveals-all-about-her-rollercoaster-career-115875-21342665/ |title=Alehsa Dixon reveals all about her rollercoaster career |publisher=mirror.co.uk |date=2009-05-08 |accessdate=2009-07-12}} Dixon in an interview also said "somebody stole my laugh and made it into a ringtone".{{Cite news|author= |title=Senkveld med Thomas & Harald|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OLdVZVzzTyg|work=|date= |accessdate= }} ==Discography== {{Main|Alesha Dixon discography}} {{see also|Mis-Teeq discography}}
